question: Pointing to a photograph of a girl, Jagesh said her father is the only son of my sister's paternal grandmother. How is Jagesh related to that girl?
solution:
Pointing to a photograph of a girl, Jagesh said her father is the only son of my sister's paternal grandmother.

Jagesh is the brother of that girl.

question:
Which of the following numbers will replace the question mark(?) in the given series?

260, 248, 224, 188, 140, ?, 8

Which letter-cluster will replace the question mark(?) to complete the given series?

BRKO, DTMQ, FVOS, HXQU, JZSW, LBUY, ?
solution:
A (1)B (2)C (3)D (4)E (5)F (6)G (7)H (8)I (9)J (10)K (11)L (12)M (13)
Z (26)Y (25)X (24)W (23)V (22)U (21)T (20)S (19)R (18)Q (17)P (16)O (15)N (14)
B (2)R (18)K (11)O (15)BRKO
B+2=DR+2=TK+2=MO+2=QDTMQ
D+2=FT+2=VM+2=OQ+2=SFVOS
F+2=HV+2=XO+2=QS+2=UHXQU
H+2=JX+2=ZQ+2=SU+2=WJZSW
J+2=LZ+2=BS+2=UW+2=YLBUY
L+2=NB+2=DU+2=WY+2=ANDWA

Thus, the answer is option (a).

question:
In this question, three statements are given, followed by three conclusions numbered I, II and III. Assuming the statements to be true, even if they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the conclusions logically follows/follow from the statements.

Statements:

Some Knife is Blade

Some Blade is Scalpel

No Scalpel is Spear

Conclusions:

I. No Blade is Spear

II. Some Blade is not Spear

III. Some Knife can be Scalpel
option_2: Both conclusions II and III follow
option_4: Both conclusions I and III follow
solution:
Statements:

Some Knife is Blade

Some Blade is Scalpel

No Scalpel is Spear

No Blade is Spear: There is no direct relation between Blade and Spear. So, conclusion I does not follows.

Some Blade is not Spear: Some Blade is Scalpel. No Scalpel is Spear. Thus, some Blade which is Scalpel is not Spear. So, conclusion II follows.

Some Knife can be Scalpel: There is no direct relation between Knife and Scalpel. Thus, there is a possibility of some Knife being Scalpel. So, conclusion III follows.

Hence, Both conclusions II and III follow.


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p26708/image013.png

question: In each of the following questions, four letter clusters have been given out of which three are alike in some manner, while the fourth one is different. Choose out the odd one.

Option (d): Q(R)S(TU)V

question: In a certain code language, 'ADVISE' is coded as '60' and 'MOUNT' is coded as '83'. How will 'FIREWALL' be coded in that language?
solution:
A (1)B (2)C (3)D (4)E (5)F (6)G (7)H (8)I (9)J (10)K (11)L (12)M (13)
Z (26)Y (25)X (24)W (23)V (22)U (21)T (20)S (19)R (18)Q (17)P (16)O (15)N (14)

'ADVISE' is coded as '60'

A (1) + D (4) + V (22) + I (9) + S (19) + E(5) = 60

'MOUNTAIN' is coded as '2835'

M (13) + O (15) + U (21) + N (14) + T (20) = 83

Similarly,

FIREWALL

F (6) + I (9) + R (18) + E (5) + W (23) + A (1) + L (12) + L (12) = 86

'FIREWALL' will be coded as '86'.

question: In a certain code language, 'CHAMBER' is coded as '343' and 'RAMEN' is coded as '125'. How will 'TECHNIQUE' be coded in that language?
solution:
A (1)B (2)C (3)D (4)E (5)F (6)G (7)H (8)I (9)J (10)K (11)L (12)M (13)
Z (26)Y (25)X (24)W (23)V (22)U (21)T (20)S (19)R (18)Q (17)P (16)O (15)N (14)

'CHAMBER' is coded as '343'

Total letter in the word = 7

73 = 343

'RAMEN' is coded as '125'

Total letters in the word = 5

53 = 125

Similarly,

TECHNIQUE

Total letters in the word = 9

93 = 729

'TECHNIQUE' will be coded as '729'.

question: The positions of how many letters will remain unchanged if all the letters in the word GREATEST are arranged in English alphabetical order?

GREATEST

After rearranging the letters of the above words in English alphabetical order-

AEEGRSTT

Two letters i.e. E and T will remain unchanged.

question:
In the following question, which one set of letters when sequentially placed at the gaps in the given letter series shall complete it?

q _ z p _ q a _ z p m _ _ a z _ z p m _ m
option_1: a, m, z, m, q, z, m
option_2: a, p, z, m, q, z, m
option_3: a, m, z, a, q, z, m
option_4: a, p, z, a, q, z, m
solution:
In this, after every repetition z and m is added in the sequence 'qazpm'.

q a z p m q a z z p m m q a z z z p m m m

So, option (a) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the option in which the numbers share the same relationship as that shared by the given pair of numbers.

(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)

20 : 289

11 : 64
solution:
Here, the pattern is:

20 : 289 = (20 - 3)2 = 172 = 289.

11 : 64 = (11 - 3)2 = 82 = 64.

Similarly,

Option (a) 23 : 361 = (23 - 3)2 = 202 = 400. So, option (a) is incorrect.

Option (b) 7 : 25 = (7 - 3)2 = 42 = 16. So, option (b) is incorrect.

Option (c) 9 : 36 = (9 - 3)2 = 62 = 36. So, option (c) is correct.

Option (d) 15 : 169 = (15 - 3)2 = 122 = 144. So, option (d) is incorrect.

question:
'Lungs' is related to 'Respiratory organ' in the same way as '__' is related to 'Transpiratory organ'.

(The words must be considered as meaningful English words and must not be related to each other based on the number of letters/number of consonants/vowels in the word.)
solution:
The primary organs of the human respiratory system are the lungs. The lungs are spongy organs that facilitate the exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide between the air and the blood.

The primary organ of transpiration in plants is the leaf stomata. Stomata are small pores on the underside of leaves that allow water to escape in the form of water vapor.

question:
Which of the following interchanges of numbers (not digits) would make the given equation correct?

1281 ÷ 6 - 5 x 3 + 7 x 384 ÷ 14 x 2 - 17 + 9 = 36
solution:
Option (a) If the numbers 6 and 9 are interchanged, then the equation will be: 1281 ÷ 9 - 5 x 3 + 7 x 384 ÷ 14 x 2 - 17 + 6

= 129 - 5 x 3 + 7 x 36 x 2 - 17 + 6

= 129 - 15 + 7 x 312 - 17 + 6

= 1216 - 15 x 318 - 17

= 121 x 31

= 36

So, the equation is correct.

Option (b) If the numbers 2 and 3 are interchanged, then the equation will be: 1281 ÷ 6 - 5 x 2 + 7 x 384 ÷ 14 x 3 - 17 + 9

= 1213.5 - 5 x 2 + 7 x 36 x 3 - 17 + 9

= 1213.5 - 10 + 7 x 318 - 17 + 9

= 1220.5 - 10 x 327 - 17

= 1210.5 x 310

So, 1210.5 x 310 ≠ 36.

So, the equation is incorrect.

Option (c) If the numbers 7 and 17 are interchanged, then the equation will be: 1281 ÷ 6 - 5 x 3 + 17 x 384 ÷ 14 x 2 - 7 + 9

= 1213.5 - 5 x 3 + 17 x 36 x 2 - 7 + 9

= 1213.5 - 15 + 17 x 312 - 7 + 9

= 1230.5 - 15 x 321 - 7

= 1215.5 x 314

So, 1215.5 x 314≠ 36.

So, the equation is incorrect.

Option (d) If the numbers 3 and 14 are interchanged, then the equation will be: 1281 ÷ 6 - 5 x 14 + 7 x 384 ÷ 3 x 2 - 17 + 9

= 1213.5 - 5 x 14 + 7 x 328 x 2 - 17 + 9

= 1213.5 - 70 + 7 x 356 - 17 + 9

= 1220.5 - 70 x 365 - 17

= 12-49.5 x 348

So, 12-49.5 x 348 ≠ 36.

So, the equation is incorrect.

question:
Select the correct combination of mathematical signs to replace the * signs and balance the given equation.

16 * 4 * 84 * 2 * 22 * 150
solution:
Option (a) If * signs are replaced by +, - , ÷, x, = signs sequentially, then the equation will be: 16 + 4 - 84 ÷ 2 x 22 = 150

So, 16 + 4 - 42 x 22 = 150

So, 16 + 4 - 924 = 150

So, 20 - 924 = 150

So, -904 ≠ 150

So, the equation is not balanced.

Option (b) If * signs are replaced by x, =, ÷, +, - signs sequentially, then the equation will be: 16 x 4 = 84 ÷ 2 + 22 - 150

So, 16 x 4 = 42 + 22 - 150

So, 64 = 42 + 22 - 150

So, 64 = 64 - 150

So, 64 ≠ -86

So, the equation is not balanced.

Option (c) If * signs are replaced by ÷, +, x, - , = signs sequentially, then the equation will be: 16 ÷ 4 + 84 x 2 - 22 = 150

So, 4 + 84 x 2 - 22 = 150

So, 4 + 168 - 22 = 150

So, 172 - 22 = 150

So, 150 = 150

So, the equation is balanced.

Option (d) If * signs are replaced by - , x, =, +, - signs sequentially, then the equation will be: 16 - 4 x 84 = 2 + 22 - 150

So, 16 - 336 = 2 + 22 - 150

So, -320 = 24 - 150

So, -320 ≠ -126

So, the equation is not balanced.

question: In a certain code language, HOUSEWARMING is written as GNIMHOUSRAWE. How will DISCOUNTABLE be written as in that language?
solution:
Here, the pattern is:

HOUSEWARMING is written as GNIMHOUSRAWE.

The position of first four letters is occupied by the last 4 letters i.e., M, I, N, G but in the opposite order.

The position of next four letters is occupied by the first 4 letters i.e., H, O, U, S.

The position of the next four letters is occupied by the middle 4 letters i.e., E, W, A, R but in opposite order.

Similarly,

DISCOUNTABLE is written as ELBADISCTNUO.

question: In a class of 38 students. A's rank from the top was 18th. If there are four students ranked between A's rank and B's rank, then what will be B's rank from the top?
solution:
A's rank is 18th.

B's rank can be 18-4-1 = 13th or 18+4+1 = 23rd

So, the rank of B cannot be determined.

No data is record.

option_2: Both conclusions I and II follow

question: The Sankirtana is a ritual dance and music form of ______inscribed in the Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity of the UNESCO in 2013.
solution: The Sankirtana is a ritual dance and music form of Manipur.The performing space is a square which faces the east and the performance itself is executed in a circle. This unique cultural heritage of Manipur was inscribed in the Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity of the UNESCO in 2013.

question: Which of the following is a group of primitive vertebrates having a large jawless sucking mouth, no limbs or paired fins and a completely cartilaginous skeleton with a persistent notochord?
solution:
·Cyclostomata is a class or order of primitive vertebrates that have a large jawless sucking mouth, no limbs or paired fins, a wholly cartilaginous skeleton with persistent notochord, and 6 to 14 pairs of gill pouches and that include the lampreys and the hagfishes.

·All living members of this class are ectoparasites on some fishes. Circulation is of closed type. Cyclostomes are marine but migrate for spawning to fresh water.

·After spawning, within a few days, they die. Their larvae, after metamorphosis, return to the ocean.

Further insights:

·Aschelminthes: Also known as roundworms, they are unsegmented, bilaterally symmetrical, and pseudocoelomate animals with a simple body structure.

· Hemichordata: Marine organisms with a body divided into proboscis, collar, and trunk, exhibiting features intermediate between non-chordates and chordates.

· Arthropoda: The largest animal phylum, characterized by a segmented body, jointed appendages, and an exoskeleton made of chitin.

question: Through which of the following Writs the court can command a public official to perform the official duties that he has failed or refused to perform?
solution:
Mandamus: It literally means 'we command'. It is a command issued by the court to a public official asking him to perform his official duties that he has failed or refused to perform. It can also be issued against any public body, a corporation, an inferior court, a tribunal or government for the same purpose.

Further insights:

Habeas Corpus: "Produce the body" - a legal order demanding that a detained person be brought before a court to determine the legality of their imprisonment.

Certiorari: "To be more fully informed" - a court order directing a lower court to deliver its record in a case so that a higher court can review it.

Quo Warranto: "By what warrant" - a legal action challenging the right of a person to hold public office.

question: When Ethyl alcohol is reacted with oxygen it forms ____.
solution:
· Reaction: CH3CH2OH(l) + O2(g) à CH3COOH (aq) + H2O(l)

· Ethyl alcohol and oxygen produce acetic acid and water.

· Significance: Wine becomes sour with age and exposure to the air. This is due to the conversion of alcohol to acetic acid (vinegar).

question: The term Blue Line is associated with which of the following games?
solution:
The term Blue Line is associated with Ice Hockey.

In ice hockey, the Blue Line refers to the two blue lines that run parallel to each other across the ice rink, dividing the rink into three zones: the defensive zone, the neutral zone, and the attacking zone.

Other terms used in Ice Hockey are:

Puck - The rubber disk used in the game.

Faceoff - The method of starting or resuming play.

Power Play - A situation where a team has more players due to a penalty.

Penalty Box - The area where players serve time for penalties.

Offside - When a player enters the attacking zone before the puck.

Icing - A violation where the puck is shot past the opponents goal line without being touched.

Hat Trick - Scoring three goals in a single game.

Slap Shot - A powerful shot made by swinging the stick.

Assist - A pass leading directly to a goal.

Checking - Using the body or stick to disrupt an opponent's play.

Goalie/Goaltender - The player who defends the goal.

Zamboni - The machine used to resurface the ice.

Breakaway - A situation where a player has a clear path to the goal.

Blue Line - Divides the ice into three zones.

Sin Bin - Informal term for the penalty box.

question: In February 2024, a 390-year-old Deepastambham (lamp post) was found on the banks of which of the following river?
solution:
The 390-year-old Deepastambham (lamp post) was found on the banks of the River Krishna in Mudimanikyam village, Nalgonda district, Telangana.

Archaeologists working in the area found the 20-foot tall pillar with hollows for lamps and a multi-lingual inscription in Mudimanikyam village of Nalgonda in Telangana.

It casts a fresh light on trade ties in the region in early medieval times.

question: Who among the following became the chief minister of Telangana in December 2023?
solution:
The Congress central leadership named Telangana party chief A. Revanth Reddy as its choice of Chief Minister of the State. He took the oath of office on December 7, 2023.

Mr. Reddy was named the leader of the Congress Legislature Party (CLP), and he will become the first Congress Chief Minister of Telangana, a State formed in 2014. Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge gave his stamp of approval on the basis of a report submitted by the partys poll observers.

question: Addition of Product taxes and deduction of product subsidies from GVA basic prices will provide __________.
solution:
The addition of product taxes and the deduction of product subsidies from Gross Value Added (GVA) at basic prices will provide the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) at market prices.

GVA at factor cost + (Production taxes less Production subsidies) = GVA at basic prices

GDP at market prices = GVA at basic prices + Product taxes- Product subsidies

question: Which of the following diseases is caused by a deficiency of Vitamin D?
solution:
Rickets is a disease that is caused by a deficiency of Vitamin D. Vitamin D is essential for the absorption of calcium and phosphorus, which are necessary for the development and strengthening of bones. Deficiency of Vitamin D can lead to weak and deformed bones, especially in children.

Scurvy: A severe vitamin C deficiency, leading to weakness, bleeding gums, and poor wound healing.

Pellagra: A deficiency of niacin (vitamin B3), causing skin rashes, dementia, and diarrhea.

Beriberi: A deficiency of thiamine (vitamin B1), resulting in muscle weakness, heart problems, and neurological issues.

question: Who passed the Indian Universities Act in 1904?
solution:
The British Viceroy, Lord Curzon(Viceroy of India from 1899 to 1905) was a staunch imperialist and believed in the superiority of the English people. He passed an Act in 1898, making it an offence to provoke people against the British rulers. He passed the Indian Universities Act in 1904, imposing stiff control over Indian Universities.

Further insights:

William Bentinck (Governor-General of India from 1828 to 1835): Introduced major reforms such as the abolition of Sati, promotion of English education, and the suppression of Thuggee.

Lord Mountbatten (Last Viceroy of India, 1947) oversaw the partition of India and Pakistan in 1947, leading to independence, and the transfer of power from British rule to Indian sovereignty.

Lord Canning (Governor-General of India from 1856 to 1862)managed the aftermath of the Indian Rebellion of 1857, introduced reforms to stabilize the administration, and was the first Viceroy of India after the rebellion.

question: India won 21 medals, including seven gold, to top the tally at the second World Deaf Shooting Championships in ____________.
solution:
India won 21 medals, including seven gold, to top the tally at the second World Deaf Shooting Championships in Hanover, Germany.

India also won seven silver and as many bronze medals.

The International Committee of Sports for the Deaf organised the 2024 World Deaf Shooting Championship in Hanover, Germany, from 29 August to -8 September 2024.

question: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maandhan is a voluntary and contributory pension scheme under which the beneficiary would receive a minimum assured pension of ______ per month.
solution: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maandhan is a government scheme meant for old age protection and social security of Unorganized Workers (UW).It is a voluntary and contributory pension scheme under which the beneficiary would receive a minimum assured pension of Rs 3000/- per month after attaining the age of 60 years and if the beneficiary dies, the spouse of the beneficiary shall be entitled to receive 50% of the pension as family pension. Family pension is applicable only to spouse.

question: Iltutmish acquired the throne of Delhi Sultanate after the death of which ruler?
solution: Iltutmish came to power after the death of his predecessor Qutb-ud-din Aibak. He was chosen as the Sultan by the nobles and military commanders due to his experience and administrative skills.

question: Which of the following damage the ozone layer of the atmosphere?
solution:
· The ozone layer protects us from harmful ultraviolet rays of the sun.

· The pollutants such as chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) which are used in refrigerators, air conditioners and aerosol sprays.

·Efforts like the Montreal Protocol have been successful in phasing out the use of CFCs globally.

· CFCs damage the ozone layer of the atmosphere.

· Nitrogen itself does not directly damage the ozone layer. However, nitrogen oxides from industrial emissions and supersonic aircraft can participate in ozone depletion.

·Argon is an inert noble gas and does not react with ozone or contribute to its depletion.

·Sulfur compounds can contribute to air pollution and acid rain but are not primary contributors to ozone layer damage.

question: Competition Commission of India works under the administrative control of ____.
solution:
The Competition Commission of India(CCI) is the chief national competition regulator in India. It is a statutory body within the Ministry of Corporate Affairs.

CCI consists of a Chairperson and 6 Members appointed by the Central Government.

It is the duty of the Commission to eliminate practices having adverse effect on competition, promote and sustain competition, protect the interests of consumers and ensure freedom of trade in the markets of India. It was established in 2003 under Competition Act, 2002.

question: When did Rohini Bhate win the Kalidas Samman?
solution:
Rohini Bhate was a senior most Kathak dance exponent. She was awarded the Kalidas Samman in 2000-01.

Other awards won by her:

1977: Maharashtra Rajya Puraskar

1979: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award

1990: Maharashtra Gaurav Puraskar

2006: Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship

2007: Akademi Ratna award from the Sangeet Natak Akademi, New Delhi

question: The first day of Pongal is celebrated as Bhogi Pongal in Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka. It honours which of the following Lords?
solution:
The first day of Pongal is celebrated as Bhogi Pongal in Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka.

The main purpose of Bhogi Pongal is to honour Lord Indra, the god of rain, and it represents the discarding of useless items to make room for a new beginning and crop.

question: At an altitude of about 6200 feet, Diengiei Peak is the second highest peak in __________
solution:
At a distance of 22 km from Umiam Lake and 40 km from Shillong, Diengiei Peak is a mountain peak in Shillong, Meghalaya.

At an altitude of about 6200 feet, Diengiei Peak is the second highest peak in Meghalaya which is just 200 feet shorter than the Shillong Peak. It is situated to the west of the Shillong plateau.

question: In Dravidian architecture, 'Vritta' represents which shape of architecture?
solution:
Of the different styles of temple architecture in India, the Nagara architecture of northern Indian and the Dravidian architecture of southern India are most common.

Dravidian architecture:

It consists primarily of Hindu temples where the dominating feature is the high gopura or gatehouse; large temples have several.

This style of architecture can also be found in parts of North India (Teli ka Mandir Gwalior, Bhitargaon Baitala Deula, Bhubaneshwar), North-eastern and central Sri Lanka.

These are basically of five different shapes:

Kuta or chaturasra - square

Shala or ayatasra - rectangular

Gaja-prishta or vrittayata (elephant backed) - elliptic

Vritta - circular

Ashtasra - octagonal

question: Which of the following rivers flow through the trough faults of the peninsular block and hence made these rivers devoid of alluvial and deltaic deposits?
solution:
The Northern flank of the peninsular block was subjected to subsidence and the consequent trough faulting occurred. Trough fault is a usually long and narrow depression bounded on either side by faults.

The Narmada and The Tapi rivers flow in these trough faults and fill the original cracks with their detritus. This has made these rivers devoid of alluvial and deltaic deposits.

question:
Match the following:

1. Fishinga. Tertiary sector
2. Manufacturingb. Secondary sector
3. Bankingc. Primary sector
solution:
Primary sector industries - Agriculture, Fishing, Forestry, and Mining.

Secondary sector industries - Manufacturing, food processing, oil refining, furniture, energy generation, etc.

Tertiary sector industries - Insurance, Banking, Government, Education, Tourism, Retail, Social service, etc.

question: Which of the following words was NOT included in the Preamble of Indian Constitution through 42nd Constitutional Amendment Act, 1976?
solution:
The Preamble was amended only once in December 1976 by the government to introduce the words 'socialist' and 'secular'.

The changes were made in the Preamble through the 42nd Constitutional Amendment during the Emergency.

Originally, the text of the Preamble declared India as a 'sovereign, democratic republic'.

The words 'socialist', 'secular' were inserted between 'sovereign' and 'democratic'.

question: Which article of the Indian Constitution defines a money bill?
solution:
Article 110 of the Constitution of India 1949

· A Bill shall be deemed to be a Money Bill if it contains only provisions dealing with all or any of the following matters, namely:

· the imposition, abolition, remission, alteration or regulation of any tax;

· the regulation of the borrowing of money or the giving of any guarantee by the Government of India, or the amendment of the law with respect to any financial obligations undertaken or to be undertaken by the Government of India.

Further insights:

Article 100 deals with the procedure for voting in the Houses of Parliament (Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha).

Article 112 mandates that the Union Government must present an annual financial statement (commonly called the Union Budget) before Parliament.

Article 111 specifies the procedure for the President's assent to a bill.

question: Hem Chandra Goswami received the Padma Shri in 2023 for reviving the art of traditional mask making of _________
solution:
In March 2023, President Murmu presented the Padma Shri award to Hem Chandra Goswami in the field of art at Civil Investiture Ceremony-I at Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi.

Hem Chandra Goswami is a stalwart sattriya artist known in the country and abroad for his thought-provoking ability, innovation and skill. He was awarded the Padma Shri for revival of Assam's traditional masks.

Goswami has been conferred with different prestigious awards for his expertise in mask making, which includes La Mezo Da Anand Award 2012, Damodara Deva National Award 2014, PhD from Gauhati University (Honoris causa), 2017, Luitporia Lifetime Achievement Award 2018, Sangeet Natak Academy Award 2019 and Achiever Award in Excellence on Art 2022.

Masks or "mukhas" are an integral part of Vaishnative plays called "bhaonas" started and popularised by 15th-century social and religious reformer Srimanta Sankardev.

question: M and N started a business by investing ₹6400 and ₹7200 respectively. The ratio of share of profit received after one year is 4:9 respectively. If N invested for 12 months, then for how many months M invested his amount?
solution:
Let the number of months M invested = X

Ratio of share of profit = 4:9

(6400 * X) : (7200 * 12) = 4:9

2X/27 = 4/9

X = 6

question: Find the sum of all the possible value of (X + Y), so that the number 380X3Y79 is divisible by 11.
solution:
If the difference between the sum of odd digits and sum of even digits of a number is 0 or multiple of 11, then the number is divisible by 11.

For the given number,

Sum of odd digits = 13

Sum of even digits = 17 + X + Y

Difference = 17 + X + Y - 13 = 4 + X + Y, to be divisible by 11, (X + Y) is either 7 or 18.

Now required sum = 7 + 18 = 25.

question: Vikas and Rohit are running around a circular track starting from the same point at the same time in the same direction. Vikas can complete one full round of circular track in 8 minutes whereas Rohit takes 15 minutes to do the same. If they run for 4 hours then how many times they both will be diametrically opposite to each other?
solution:
Total number of rounds completed by Vikas in 4 hours = 240/8 = 30

Total number of rounds completed by Rohit in 4 hours = 240/15 = 16

Number of times Vikas will overtake Rohit = (30 - 16) = 14

Hence, they both will be diametrically opposite to each other 14 times.

question: Mahesh purchased two items P and Q at total cost of ₹4500. He then sold items P and Q at 30% and 20% profit respectively. He earns a total profit of 24%, then find the difference between cost prices of items P and Q.
solution:
Using Aligation Method,

Cost price of P/Cost price of Q = (30% profit - 24% profit)/(24% profit - 20% profit) = 3/2

Given that,

Total cost price or we can say 5 units = Rs.4500

Difference between cost prices or 1 unit = 4500/5 = Rs.900

question: If an item is marked at Rs. 3640 and sold after two successive discounts of 14.28% and 25%, what is its selling price (in Rs.)?
5 men and 8 women can complete a work in 12 days working together, while 3 men and 7 women together can complete the same work in 15 days. In how many days will 11 women complete the same work?
solution:
Let work done by 1 man in a day = m

Work done by 1 woman in a day = w

So,

5m + 8w = 1/12→ 15m + 24w = ¼ ------------(1)

3m + 7w = 1/15 → 15m + 35w = 1/3 ----------(2)

On solving both equations-

11w =1/12

So, 11 women will complete the same work in 12 days.

question: The sum of cubes of three natural numbers is 972, and they are in the proportion of 2: 1: 3. What is the difference between the square of largest number and the square of smallest number?
solution:
Let numbers are 2x, x, and 3x, respectively.

According to the question,

(2x)3 + x3 + (3x)3 = 972

=> 8x3 + x3 + 27x3 = 972

=> x3 = 972/36

=> x = 3

So, required difference = (3x)2 - x2 = 9x2 - x2 = 8x2 = 8 * 9 = 72

question:

The number of students who score more than 40 but less than 80 is what percentage more or less than the number of students who score less than 60?


https://u1.oliveboard.in/exams/solution/oliveimg/p9899/image002.png
solution:
The number of students who score more 40 but less than 80 = 40 + 32 = 72

The number of students who score less than 60 = 16 + 34 + 40 = 90

So, required % = ((90 - 72)/90) * 100 = 20%

= 4 + 4

question: A mixture of 52 litres contains milk and water in the ratio of 2:3 respectively. If 7 litres of mixture is taken out and replaced with 12 litres of milk, then find the quantity of milk in the final mixture.
solution:
Quantity of mixture when 7 litres of mixture is taken out = 52 - 7 = 45 litres

Quantity of milk in 45 litres of mixture = 45*2/5 = 18 litres

Quantity of milk in the final mixture = 18 + 12 = 30 litres

question: In Δ WXY, WX = WY, and XZ is the bisector of ∠ WXY. P is a point on XY such that WP divides the ∠ XWY in the ratio 1: 3. WP and XZ intersect at point O and if ∠ XWY = 5A° then, find the measure of ∠ WOZ.
solution:
Given, ∠ XWY = 5A°

SO, ∠ XWP = 5A * ¼ = (5A/4) °

Given, WX = WY

So, ∠ WXY = ∠ WYX

We know that,

∠ WXY + ∠ WYX + ∠ XWY = 180

2∠ WXY = 180 - 5A

∠ WXY = 90 - (5A/2) °

Given that XZ is the bisector of ∠ WXY.

So, ∠ WXZ = ∠ WXY/2 = 45 - (5A/4) °

Since ∠ WOZ is an external angle.

So, ∠ WOZ = ∠ WXZ + ∠ XWP

= 45 - (5A/4) + (5A/4) = 45°

So, required value = sin2θ - sin θ cos θ + cos2θ = 1 - sin θ cos θ

question: In a bag there are marbles of two different colors - white and black of two different sizes - small and large. 30% of total marbles are black and 30% of total marbles are small. If 2/7th of white marbles are small, what fraction of the black marbles are large?
solution:
Let total number of marbles in bag = X

Number of black marbles in bag = 3X/10

Number of white marbles in bag = 7X/10

Number of small marbles in bag = 3X/10

Number of large marbles in bag = 7X/10

Number of small white marbles = 2/7 * (7X/10) = X/5

Number of small black marbles = (3X/10) - (X/5) = X/10

Number of large black marbles = (3X/10) - (X/10) = X/5

Required fraction = (X/5)/(3X/10) = 2/3.

If x3 + y3 + z3 + 10 = 0, xy + zx = 6 - yz and (x + y + z)2 = 25, then what is the value of x2y2z2, if (x + y + z) > 0?
solution:
x3 + y3 + z3 + 10 = 0, i.e., x3 + y3 + z3 = - 10

xy + zx = 6 - yz, i.e., xy + zx + yz = 6

(x + y + z)2 = 25, i.e., x + y + z = 5 as x + y + z > 0

x3 + y3 + z3 - 3xyz = (x + y + z)(x2 + y2 + z2 - xy - yz - zx)

Also, x2 + y2 + z2 = (x + y + z)2 - 2(xy + yz + zx)

x3 + y3 + z3 - 3xyz = (x + y + z)(x2 + y2 + z2 - xy - yz - zx)

x3 + y3 + z3 - 3xyz = (x + y + z)(((x + y + z)2 - 2(xy + yz + zx)) - xy - yz - zx)

- 10 - 3xyz = 5 * (25 - 2 * 6 - 6)

- 10 - 3xyz = 5 * 7

3xyz = - 45

xyz = - 15

So, x2y2z2 = (-15)2 = 225

question: ∆ABC is an equilateral triangle and AD is perpendicular to BC, where D lies on BC. If AD = 4√3 cm, then what is the perimeter (in cm) of ∆ABC?
solution:
Since, ∆ABC is an equilateral triangle, so

AD = (√3/2) * side of triangle

4√3 = (√3/2) * side of triangle

Side of triangle = 8 cm

Perimeter of triangle = 8 + 8 + 8 = 24 cm

How many students obtain 40 marks or more but less than 70 marks?
solution: Number of students obtain 40 marks or more but less than 70 marks = number of students obtain less than 70 marks - number of students obtain less than 40 marks = 44 - 10 = 34.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

The crowing witch released _______ crackle as she turned the boy into a beast.
solution:
The blank requires an adjective to describe the noun 'crackle' (a sound made up of a rapid succession of short sharp noises). The word refers to high pitch noises. Among the given options, only the adjective 'loud' (producing or capable of producing much noise) can be used to describe the word 'crackle'. Others don't provide a coherent sentence.

Hence, option (c) is the correct answer.

Gentle: having or showing a mild, kind, or tender temperament or character.

Low: below average in amount, extent, or intensity.

Soft: having a pleasing quality involving a subtle effect or contrast rather than sharp definition.

The correct sentence is: The crowing witch released loud crackle as she turned the boy into a beast.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word in the following sentence.

Try to be frugal with your hard-earned money.
solution:
The word 'frugal' means 'sparing or economical as regards money or food'.

Let's look at the meanings of the given options.

Imprudent: not showing care for the consequences of an action; rash.

Economical: giving good value or return in relation to the money, time, or effort expended.

Negligent: failing to take proper care over something.

Honest: free of deceit; truthful and sincere.

Among the given options, 'economical' is the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word.

Hence, option (b) is the correct answer.

question:
The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.

The artificial intelligence group AI Now released it's annual report on how the technology is being used in society.
solution:
'It's' is a short form for 'it is' and 'it has', and 'its' is a possessive determiner that means 'belonging to or connected with the thing mentioned'. So, the use of 'it's' is incorrect in part d) as here 'its' refers to 'the artificial intelligence group' and portrays that the annual report belonged to the mentioned group. Hence, the answer is option d).

Note:

Possessive Determiners/Adjectives: Words like 'my', 'our', 'your', 'his', 'her', 'its', and 'their' are known as possessive adjectives (or possessive determiners). They come before nouns and indicate ownership of the noun. Example: The teacher asked the students to open their drawing books.

question:
Directions:

Directions [Set of 5 Questions]: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in each blank.

Murphy's Law, the __(1)__ adage, strikes fear into the hearts of optimists everywhere. "Anything that can go wrong, will go wrong" - a stark reminder that fate has a __(2)__ sense of humour. From spilled coffee to technological meltdowns, this law seems to revel in our misfortune. Just when things are going __(3)__, Murphy's Law lurks, waiting to strike. A flat tire on the way to a job interview, a __(4)__ alarm on a crucial deadline - the universe seems to conspire against us. Yet, in the face of such chaos, we find solace in the dark humour and resilience that __(5)__ humanity.



Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank no. 1.
solution:
The sentence with blank 1 describes Murphy's Law and its impact on people. The phrase "strikes fear into the hearts of optimists" suggests that Murphy's Law is widely known for its negative connotation. Among the given options, 'infamous' fits the blank as it means being well known for a bad quality or deed, which aligns with the context of Murphy's Law. Hence, (b) is the correct answer.

Other options fail to fit in contextually.

Indigenous: Originating or occurring naturally in a particular place; native.

Filtered: Removed impurities or unwanted elements.

Fleeting: Lasting for a very short time; brief.

question:

Other options fail to fit in contextually.

Generous: Showing a readiness to give more of something, such as money or time, than is strictly necessary or expected.

Shy: Being reserved or having or showing nervousness or timidity in the company of other people.

Dutiful: Conscientiously or obediently fulfilling one's duty.

Among the given options, the word 'soothing' is similar in meaning to the word 'mellifluous'. So, the two words can be used as synonyms of each other.

Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

question:

The strange TV reporter standing over there covers all the funny and interesting things happening inside the town.
solution:
'Mobile' means 'able to move or be moved freely or easily'.

'Standing' means 'to be in a vertical state or to put into a vertical state, especially (of a person or animal) by making the legs straight'.

So, both are antonyms of each other.

Hence, option (a) is the answer.

Renown

Value: importance.

question:

One who is present everywhere.
solution:
Omnipresent: one who is present everywhere.

Omnipotent: one who is all powerful.

Omnivorous: one who eats both plants and animals.

Omniscient: one who knows everything.

Hence option (a) is the right answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate antonym for the word in brackets to fill in the blank.

The dog was extremely _______(FRIENDLY).
solution:
The word 'friendly' describes someone who is kind and pleasant. The opposite of 'friendly' is 'hostile', which describes someone who is unfriendly and antagonistic.

Hence, option (a) is the correct answer.

Hostile: unfriendly; antagonistic.

Amiable: having or displaying a friendly and pleasant manner.

Affable: friendly, good-natured, or easy to talk to.

Congenial: pleasing or liked on account of having qualities or interests that are similar to one's own.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
'Nocturnel' is the incorrectly spelt word. The correct spelling is 'nocturnal' and it means 'done, occurring, or active at night'.

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the boldened idiom.

I'd been doing some quiet investigating in the meantime and had an ace up my sleeve.
option_1: To engage oneself in a secret investigation
solution: The idiom "have an ace up your sleeve" means a plan or piece of information kept secret until it becomes necessary to use it. The other meanings are contextually incorrect. Hence, c) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

The boys played a cruel trick on the dog.
option_1: A cruel trick was played by the boys on the dog.
option_2: A cruel trick was being played by the boys on the dog.
option_3: A cruel trick is played by the boys on the dog.
option_4: A cruel trick had been played by the boys on the dog.
solution:
The subject of the Active Voice is changed into the object of the Passive voice. Also, the object of the Active Voice is changed into the subject of the Passive Voice.

The Active voice in this question is in Past Indefinite. Thus, the Passive voice will also be in Past Indefinite.

The format of Active voice is: Subject + V2 + Object.

Thus, in Passive voice, the format will be: Subject (a cruel trick) + was/were + V3 + by + Object (the boys).

Option b) is incorrect as it changes the tense to past continuous. Option c) is incorrect as it changes the tense to simple present. Option d) is incorrect as it changes the tense to past perfect. Option a) follows the same structure.

Hence, option a) is the right answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select 'No substitute required'.

The soldiers had no choice to report the loss to their commander.
solution:
'Have no choice but to' is a phrase. If you have no choice but to do something or have little choice but to do it, you cannot avoid doing it.

E.g., They had little choice but to agree to what he suggested.

Therefore, the underlined segment should be replaced with 'no choice but to'.

The correct sentence is- 'The soldiers had no choice but to report the loss to their commander.'

Hence, option (d) is the correct answer.

question:
Select the option that will improve the underlined part of the given sentence. In case no improvement is needed, select 'No improvement required'.

Supposing that Chloe have thought a little more about the offer, she should have accepted it in no time.
solution:
The tense in the 'supposing that' clause should be in the Past Perfect tense (had thought) when the modal verb (should have) is in the main clause.

Note: 'Should have' represents a wish that did not come true.

Therefore, the correct answer is: (b) had thought.

The corrected form of the sentence is: Supposing that Chloe had thought a little more about the offer, she should have accepted it in no time.

Additional Information:

'Supposing that' is used in conditional sentences. The three types of conditional sentences (with examples) are given in the table.
ISupposing that I study (V1)I shall pass the exam
IISupposing that I studied (V2)I should pass the exam
IIISupposing that I had studied (had + V3)I should have passed the exam

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in future tense form.

There are several new initiatives launched for environmental conservation.
option_1: There will be several new initiatives launched for environmental conservation.
option_2: There had been several new initiatives launched for environmental conservation.
option_3: There have been several new initiatives launched for environmental conservation.
option_4: There were several new initiatives launched for environmental conservation.
solution: The option that expresses the given sentence in the future tense form is (a) (There will be several new initiatives launched for environmental conservation). This option represents the future tense, indicating that there are plans to launch several new initiatives for environmental conservation in the future. Option (b) is in the past perfect tense, suggesting that the initiatives were launched before a specific time in past. Option (c) is in the present perfect tense, suggesting that the initiatives have been launched up to the present time. Option (d) is in the past tense, indicating that the initiatives were launched in the past. Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

question:
The following sentence has been split into three segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error. If the sentence is error free, mark 'No error' as your answer.

I'll have to leave / now and else I'll miss / my train to Delhi.
solution:
We use or else to say what the result will be if something does not happen.

The sentence implies if the subject doesn't leave now, the consequence will be the subject missing the train.

So, 'and else' should be replaced with 'or else' to rectify the sentence.

So, the error is in the part in option d).

The correct sentence is: I'll have to leave now or else I'll miss my train to Delhi.

Hence, option (d) is the correct answer.

question: Select the correct sentence in active voice from the following options.
option_1: Can the experts solve the problem?
option_2: Could the problem be solved by the experts?
option_3: Can the solving of the problem be done by the experts?
option_4: Solving the problem was accomplished by the experts.
solution:
Option (a) is the correct answer.

The question in Active voice is an interrogative sentence. The answer to this question will be either "yes" or "no".

These types of sentences usually begin with a Modal Auxiliary verb.

The format of such a sentence in Active voice is: Modal + Subject + V1 + Object?

The options except (a) don't follow the correct grammatical format of the Active Voice.

Therefore, the correct answer is option (a): Can the experts solve the problem?

question:
Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the underlined group of words.

This exfoliating scrub can completely make you feel young.
solution:
WORDMEANING
RemissNot showing enough care and attention
NascentBeginning to exist and evolve
RejuvenateTo make somebody/something feel or look younger
RegaliaThe symbols of royalty

'Rejuvenate' is the right choice for the underlined word.

Hence, option (c) is correct.

question:
Identify the idiom that conveys the meaning given in brackets.

After a long day at work, the tired employee was eager to (go to bed and sleep) in order to rejuvenate.
solution: The appropriate idiom for the given meaning is 'hit the sack', which effectively implies going to bed and sleeping after a tiring day. The idiom 'hit the sack' means to go to bed to sleep. The phrases in options (b) and (c) are not common English idioms and do not convey the intended meaning. The idiom in option (d) means to begin studying or reading intensively. It does not convey the idea of going to bed and sleeping, making it an incorrect choice for the given context. Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

question:
Identify the option that arranges the given parts in the correct order to form a meaningful and coherent paragraph.

A. skilled mechanics in the bustling garage

B. causing the perplexing engine malfunction

C. after hours of careful deliberation and analysis, the

D. finally identified the elusive issue that had been
solution:
C introduces the timeframe during which the mechanics are working on the issue, implying that they have spent a considerable amount of time on it. 'A' provides the context of who is working on the issue and where they are located, setting the scene for the sentence. D reveals the culmination of their efforts, indicating that they have successfully found the root cause of the engine malfunction. B follows D logically, explaining what the elusive issue was and how it was causing the engine malfunction. Putting it all together, CADB forms a coherent and meaningful sequence. Hence, (a) is the correct answer.

The final sentence would be: After hours of careful deliberation and analysis, the skilled mechanics in the bustling garage finally identified the elusive issue that had been causing the perplexing engine malfunction.
